TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SignedXml extends System.Object

summary.span: 在核心 XML 签名对象上提供包装器，以便创建 XML 签名。

span.span: Provides a wrapper on a core XML signature object to facilitate creating XML signatures.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类是万维网联合会（W3C） [XML 签名语法和处理规范](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/)（也称为 XMLDSIG （XML 数字签名））的 .net 实现。The class is the .NET implementation of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML Signature Syntax and Processing Specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/), also known as XMLDSIG (XML Digital Signature). XMLDSIG 是一种基于标准的、可互操作的方式，用于对 XML 文档的全部或部分或其他可从统一资源标识符（URI）寻址的数据进行签名和验证。XMLDSIG is a standards-based, interoperable way to sign and verify all or part of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 只要需要以标准方式在应用程序或组织之间共享已签名的 XML 数据，就可以使用 类。Use the class whenever you need to share signed XML data between applications or organizations in a standard way. 使用此类签名的任何数据都可以通过适用于 XMLDSIG 的 W3C 规范的任何一致实现进行验证。Any data signed using this class can be verified by any conforming implementation of the W3C specification for XMLDSIG. 通过 类，您可以创建以下三种 XML 数字签名：The class allows you to create the following three kinds of XML digital signatures: |签名类型Signature Type|说明Description| |--------------------|-----------------| |已封装签名Enveloped signature|签名包含在要签名的 XML 元素中。The signature is contained within the XML element being signed.| |封装签名Enveloping signature|已签名的 XML 包含在 `` 元素中。The signed XML is contained within the `` element.| |内部分离的签名Internal detached signature|签名和签名的 XML 位于同一个文档中，但两个元素都不包含另一个。The signature and signed XML are in the same document, but neither element contains the other.| 还有第四种签名称为外部分离签名，即当数据和签名位于单独的 XML 文档中时。There is also a fourth kind of signature called an external detached signature which is when the data and signature are in separate XML documents. 类不支持外部分离签名。External detached signatures are not supported by the class. ## XML 签名的结构The structure of an XML Signature XMLDSIG 创建 `` 元素，该元素包含 XML 文档的数字签名或可从 URI 寻址的其他数据。XMLDSIG creates a `` element, which contains a digital signature of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a URI. `` 元素可以选择包含有关在何处查找将验证签名的密钥的信息，以及使用哪种加密算法进行签名。The `` element can optionally contain information about where to find a key that will verify the signature and which cryptographic algorithm was used for signing. 基本结构如下所示：The basic structure is as follows: ```xml Base64EncodedValue== AnotherBase64EncodedValue=== ``` 此结构的主要部分是：The main parts of this structure are: - `` 元素The `` element 指定用于将 XML/text 中的 `Signature` 元素重写为用于签名验证的字节的规则。Specifies the rules for rewriting the `Signature` element from XML/text into bytes for signature validation. .NET 中的默认值为 ，该默认值标识可信算法。The default value in .NET is , which identifies a trustworthy algorithm. 此元素由 属性表示。This element is represented by the property. - `` 元素The `` element 指定用于签名生成和验证的算法，该算法应用于 `` 元素以在 ``中生成值。Specifies the algorithm used for signature generation and validation, which was applied to the `` element to produce the value in ``. 在上面的示例中，值 标识 RSA PKCS1 SHA-1 签名。In the previous example, the value identifies an RSA PKCS1 SHA-1 signature. 由于 SHA-1 出现冲突，Microsoft 建议使用基于 SHA-256 或更高安全性的安全模式。Due to collision problems with SHA-1, Microsoft recommends a security model based on SHA-256 or better. 此元素由 属性表示。This element is represented by the property. - `` 元素The `` element 指定 `` 元素的加密签名。Specifies the cryptographic signature for the `` element. 如果此签名未进行验证，则部分 `` 块已被篡改，并且文档被视为无效。If this signature does not verify, then some portion of the `` block was tampered with, and the document is considered invalid. 只要 `` 值可信，此值就会受到篡改。As long as the `` value is trustworthy, this value is highly resistant to tampering. 此元素由 属性表示。This element is represented by the property. - `` 元素的 `URI` 特性The `URI` attribute of the `` element 使用 URI 引用指定数据对象。Specifies a data object using a URI reference. 此属性由 属性表示。This attribute is represented by the property. - 如果未指定 `URI` 特性，即将 属性设置为 `null`，则表示接收应用程序应知道对象的标识。Not specifying the `URI` attribute, that is, setting the property to `null`, means that the receiving application is expected to know the identity of the object. 在大多数情况下，`null` URI 将导致引发异常。In most cases, a `null` URI will result in an exception being thrown. 不要使用 `null` URI，除非应用程序与需要它的协议进行互操作。Do not use a `null` URI, unless your application is interoperating with a protocol which requires it. - 如果将 `URI` 特性设置为空字符串，则指示将对文档的根元素进行签名，这是一种封装签名格式。Setting the `URI` attribute to an empty string indicates that the root element of the document is being signed, a form of enveloped signature. - 如果 `URI` 属性的值以 # 开头，则该值必须解析为当前文档中的元素。If the value of `URI` attribute starts with #, then the value must resolve to an element in the current document. 此窗体可用于任何受支持的签名类型（已封装签名、封装签名或内部分离签名）。This form can be used with any of the supported signature types (enveloped signature, enveloping signature or internal detached signature). - 其他任何内容均视为外部资源分离签名，并且不受 类支持。Anything else is considered an external resource detached signature and is not supported by the class. - `` 元素The `` element 包含一个 `` 元素的有序列表，这些元素描述签名者如何获取已摘要的数据对象。Contains an ordered list of `` elements that describe how the signer obtained the data object that was digested. 转换算法类似于规范化方法，但不重写 `` 元素，它会重写由 `` 元素的 `URI` 属性标识的内容。A transform algorithm is similar to the canonicalization method, but instead of rewriting the `` element, it rewrites the content identified by the `URI` attribute of the `` element. `` 元素由 类表示。The `` element is represented by the class. - 每个转换算法定义为采用 XML （XPath 节点集）或字节作为输入。Each transform algorithm is defined as taking either XML (an XPath node-set) or bytes as input. 如果当前数据的格式与转换输入要求不同，则应用转换规则。If the format of the current data differs from the transform input requirements, conversion rules are applied. - 每个转换算法定义为作为输出产生 XML 或字节。Each transform algorithm is defined as producing either XML or bytes as the output. - 如果未按字节（或未指定任何转换）定义最后一个转换算法的输出，则[规范化方法](https://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315)将用作隐式转换（即使 `` 元素中指定了不同的算法）。If the output of the last transform algorithm is not defined in bytes (or no transforms were specified), then the [canonicalization method](https://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315) is used as an implicit transform (even if a different algorithm was specified in the `` element). - 转换算法的 的值对规则进行编码，该规则被解释为从文档中删除 `` 元素。A value of for the transform algorithm encodes a rule which is interpreted as remove the `` element from the document. 否则，被封包的签名的验证程序将简要说明文档，包括签名，但签名者在应用签名之前会摘要文档，这会导致不同的答案。Otherwise, a verifier of an enveloped signature will digest the document, including the signature, but the signer would have digested the document before the signature was applied, leading to different answers. - `` 元素The `` element 标识要应用于 `` 元素的 `URI` 属性标识的已转换内容的摘要（加密哈希）方法。Identifies the digest (cryptographic hash) method to apply on the transformed content identified by the `URI` attribute of the `` element. 这由 属性表示。This is represented by the property. ## 选择规范化方法Choosing a canonicalization method 除非与要求使用不同值的规范进行互操作，否则建议使用默认的 .NET 规范化方法，该方法是 C14N 1.0 算法，其值 。Unless interoperating with a specification which requires the use of a different value, we recommend that you use the default .NET canonicalization method, which is the XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm, whose value is . XMLDSIG 的所有实现都需要支持 C14N 1.0 算法，特别是在它是要应用的隐式最终转换时。The XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm is required to be supported by all implementations of XMLDSIG, particularly as it is an implicit final transform to apply. 有一些规范算法支持保留注释。There are versions of canonicalization algorithms which support preserving comments. 建议不要使用注释保留的规范化方法，因为它们违反了 "已发现的签名" 原则。Comment-preserving canonicalization methods are not recommended because they violate the "sign what is seen" principle. 也就是说，`` 元素中的注释将不会更改签名的执行方式的处理逻辑，只是签名值的含义。That is, the comments in a `` element will not alter the processing logic for how the signature is performed, merely what the signature value is. 与弱签名算法结合使用时，允许包含注释会使攻击者不必要地强制进行哈希冲突，使得篡改的文档显得非常合法。When combined with a weak signature algorithm, allowing the comments to be included gives an attacker unnecessary freedom to force a hash collision, making a tampered document appear legitimate. 在 .NET Framework 中，默认情况下仅支持内置 canonicalizers。In the .NET Framework, only built-in canonicalizers are supported by default. 若要支持其他或自定义 canonicalizers，请参阅 属性。To support additional or custom canonicalizers, see the property. 如果文档使用的规范化方法不在由 属性表示的集合中，则 方法将返回 `false`。If the document uses a canonicalization method that is not in the collection represented by the property, then the method will return `false`. > [!NOTE] > 极其防御性的应用程序可以从 集合中删除不希望签署者使用的任何值。An extremely defensive application can remove any values it does not expect signers to use from the collection. ## 引用值是否安全不受篡改？Are the Reference values safe from tampering? 是的，可以安全地防止篡改 `` 值。Yes, the `` values are safe from tampering. .NET 在处理任何 `` 值及其关联转换之前验证 `` 计算，并将及早中止以避免潜在的恶意处理指令。.NET verifies the `` computation before processing any of the `` values and their associated transforms, and will abort early to avoid potentially malicious processing instructions. ## 选择要签名的元素Choosing the elements to sign 建议你将 "" 的值用于 `URI` 属性（或将 属性设置为空字符串）（如果可能）。We recommend that you use the value of "" for the `URI` attribute (or set the property to an empty string), if possible. 这意味着将整个文档视为摘要计算，这意味着整个文档受到保护，无法进行篡改。This means the whole document is considered for the digest computation, which means the whole document is protected from tampering. 通常，以锚点（如 #foo）形式查看 `URI` 值，引用 ID 属性为 "foo" 的元素。It is very common to see `URI` values in the form of anchors such as #foo, referring to an element whose ID attribute is "foo". 遗憾的是，这很容易被篡改，因为这只包括目标元素的内容，而不包含上下文。Unfortunately, it is easy for this to be tampered with because this includes only the content of the target element, not the context. 滥用这种区别称为 XML 签名包装（XSW）。Abusing this distinction is known as XML Signature Wrapping (XSW). 如果你的应用程序将注释视为语义（这在处理 XML 时不常见），则应使用 "#xpointer （/）" 而不是 "" #xpointer，而不是 "#foo"。If your application considers comments to be semantic (which is not common when dealing with XML), then you should use "#xpointer(/)" instead of "", and "#xpointer(id('foo'))" instead of "#foo". #Xpointer 版本被解释为包含注释，而短名称窗体则不包括注释。The #xpointer versions are interpreted as including comments, while the shortname forms are excluding comments. 如果需要接受仅部分保护的文档，并且想要确保读取签名保护的相同内容，请使用 方法。If you need to accept documents which are only partially protected and you want to ensure that you are reading the same content that the signature protected, use the method. ## 有关 KeyInfo 元素的安全注意事项Security considerations about the KeyInfo element 可选 `` 元素中的数据（即 属性）（其中包含用于验证签名的密钥）不应受信任。The data in the optional `` element (that is, the property), which contains a key to validate the signature, should not be trusted. 具体而言，当 值表示一个空的 RSA、DSA 或 ECDSA 公钥时，该文档可能已被篡改，尽管 方法报告签名有效。In particular, when the value represents a bare RSA, DSA or ECDSA public key, the document could have been tampered with, despite the method reporting that the signature is valid. 发生这种情况是因为执行篡改的实体只需生成新的密钥，并使用该新密钥对被篡改的文档进行重新签名。This can happen because the entity doing the tampering just has to generate a new key and re-sign the tampered document with that new key. 因此，除非应用程序验证公钥是预期值，否则应将文档视为已被篡改。So, unless your application verifies that the public key is an expected value, the document should be treated as if it were tampered with. 这要求你的应用程序检查文档中嵌入的公钥，并根据文档上下文的已知值列表对其进行验证。This requires that your application examine the public key embedded within the document and verify it against a list of known values for the document context. 例如，如果可以理解文档由已知用户颁发，则可根据该用户使用的已知密钥列表检查该密钥。For example, if the document could be understood to be issued by a known user, you'd check the key against a list of known keys used by that user. 你还可以使用 方法（而不是使用 方法）来验证处理文档后的键。You can also verify the key after processing the document by using the method, instead of using the method. 但为了获得最佳安全性，应事先验证密钥。But, for the optimal security, you should verify the key beforehand. 另外，请考虑尝试用户注册的公钥，而不是读取 `` 元素中的内容。Alternately, consider trying the user's registered public keys, rather than reading what's in the `` element. ## 有关 X509Data 元素的安全注意事项Security considerations about the X509Data element 可选 `` 元素是 `` 元素的子元素，其中包含一个或多个 x509 证书或 X509 证书的标识符。The optional `` element is a child of the `` element and contains one or more X509 certificates or identifiers for X509 certificates. `` 元素中的数据也不应是本质上受信任的。The data in the `` element should also not be inherently trusted. 使用嵌入的 `` 元素验证文档时，.NET 只验证数据是否解析为 X509 证书，该证书的公钥可以成功用于验证文档签名。When verifying a document with the embedded `` element, .NET verifies only that the data resolves to an X509 certificate whose public key can be successfully used to validate the document signature. 与调用 方法时，如果将 `verifySignatureOnly` 参数设置为 `false`，则不会执行任何吊销检查，也不会检查链信任，也不会验证过期。Unlike calling the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, no revocation check is performed, no chain trust is checked, and no expiration is verified. 即使你的应用程序提取证书本身并将其传递给 方法，并将 `verifySignatureOnly` 参数设置为 `false`，这仍不足以防止文档篡改。Even if your application extracts the certificate itself and passes it to the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, that is still not sufficient validation to prevent document tampering. 仍需验证证书是否适用于所签名的文档。The certificate still needs to be verified as being appropriate for the document being signed. 使用嵌入的签名证书可以提供有用的密钥轮换策略，无论是在 `` 部分还是文档内容中。Using an embedded signing certificate can provide useful key rotation strategies, whether in the `` section or in the document content. 使用此方法时，应用程序应手动提取证书，并执行类似于以下内容的验证：When using this approach an application should extract the certificate manually and perform validation similar to: - 证书是由证书颁发机构（CA）直接或通过证书颁发机构（CA）颁发的，证书颁发机构（CA）在应用程序中嵌入公共证书。The certificate was issued directly or via a chain by a Certificate Authority (CA) whose public certificate is embedded in the application. 使用不带额外检查的操作系统提供的信任列表（如已知使用者名称）不足以防止篡改 。Using the OS-provided trust list without additional checks, such as a known subject name, is not sufficient to prevent tampering in . - 验证证书时，证书尚未过期（或 "立即" 进行近乎实时的文档处理）。The certificate is verified to have not been expired at the time of document signing (or "now" for near real-time document processing). - 对于支持吊销的 CA 颁发的长期证书，请验证是否未吊销证书。For long-lived certificates issued by a CA which supports revocation, verify the certificate was not revoked. - 验证证书使用者是否适用于当前文档。The certificate subject is verified as being appropriate to the current document. ## 选择转换算法Choosing the transform algorithm 如果要使用已指示特定值（如 XrML）的规范进行互操作，则需要遵循规范。If you are interoperating with a specification which has dictated specific values (such as XrML), then you need to follow the specification. 如果你有一个已封装的签名（例如，在对整个文档进行签名时），则需要使用 （由 类表示）。If you have an enveloped signature (such as when signing the whole document), then you need to use (represented by the class). 还可以指定隐式 XML C14N 转换，但这不是必需的。You can specify the implicit XML-C14N transform as well, but it's not necessary. 对于封装或分离的签名，不需要进行转换。For an enveloping or detached signature, no transforms are required. 隐式 XML C14N 转换负责处理所有内容。The implicit XML-C14N transform takes care of everything. 使用[Microsoft 安全公告 MS16-035](https://docs.microsoft.com/security-updates/securitybulletins/2016/ms16-035)引入的安全性更新后，.net 限制了默认情况下可以在文档验证中使用的转换，这种转换会导致 始终返回 `false`。With the security updated introduced by the [Microsoft Security Bulletin MS16-035](https://docs.microsoft.com/security-updates/securitybulletins/2016/ms16-035), .NET has restricted what transforms can be used in document verification by default, with untrusted transforms causing to always return `false`. 特别是，不再允许使用需要额外输入的转换（指定为 XML 中的子元素），因为它们被恶意用户滥用。In particular, transforms which require additional input (specified as child elements in the XML) are no longer allowed due to their susceptibility of abuse by malicious users. W3C 建议避免使用 XPath 和 XSLT 转换，这是受这些限制影响的两个主要转换。The W3C advises avoiding the XPath and XSLT transforms, which are the two main transforms affected by these restrictions. ## 外部引用的问题The problem with external references 如果应用程序不验证外部引用是否适用于当前上下文，它们可能会以提供许多安全漏洞的方式被滥用（包括拒绝服务、分布式反射拒绝服务、信息泄露、跳过签名和远程代码执行）。If an application does not verify that external references seem appropriate for the current context, they can be abused in ways that provide for many security vulnerabilities (including Denial of Service, Distributed Reflection Denial of Service, Information Disclosure, Signature Bypass, and Remote Code Execution). 即使应用程序要验证外部引用 URI，也会在加载两次资源时出现问题：一次是在应用程序读取它时，一次是 读取它。Even if an application were to validate the external reference URI, there would remain a problem of the resource being loaded twice: once when your application reads it, and once when reads it. 由于不能保证应用程序的 "读取" 和 "文档验证" 步骤具有相同的内容，因此签名不会提供可信度。Since there's no guarantee that the application read and document verify steps have the same content, the signature does not provide trustworthiness. 由于外部引用的风险，在遇到外部引用时， 会引发异常。Given the risks of external references, will throw an exception when an external reference is encountered. 有关此问题的详细信息，请参阅[知识库文章 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3148821)。For more information about this issue, see [KB article 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3148821). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用封套签名对整个 XML 文档进行签名和验证。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature. [!code-cpp[System.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope/CPP/exampleenvelope.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope/CS/exampleenvelope.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Security.Cryptography.XML.SignedXml.ComputeSig-Check-AsymetricAlg-Envelope/VB/exampleenvelope.vb#1)] 下面的代码示例演示如何使用封装签名对 XML 文档的单个元素进行签名和验证。The following code example shows how to sign and verify a single element of an XML document using an enveloping signature. [!code-cpp[Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element/CPP/sample.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element/CS/sample.cs#1)] [!code-vb[Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Cryptography.XML.SignVerifyEnvelope - Specify Element/VB/sample.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将 `` 元素添加到描述用于创建 XML 数字签名的摘要方法、摘要值和转换的 对象。The method adds a `` element to the object that describes a digest method, digest value, and transform to use for creating an XML digital signature. `` 元素是 `` 元素的子元素。The `` element is a subelement of the `` element. 方法在内部调用由 对象封装的 对象的 方法。The method internally calls the method of the object encapsulated by the object. 还可以通过从 属性直接调用 方法来添加 对象。You can also add a object by directly calling the method from the property. 有关 XML 数字签名的详细信息，请参阅[XMLDSIG 规范](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/)。For more information about XML digital signatures, see the [XMLDSIG specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/). ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用封套签名对整个 XML 文档进行签名和验证。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法还计算引用的摘要和签名的值。This method also computes the digest of the references and the value of the signature. 如果使用 x.509 签名对 XML 文档进行签名，则 方法将在 "通讯簿" 存储中搜索适用于验证的证书。If an XML document was signed with an X.509 signature, the method will search the "AddressBook" store for certificates suitable for the verification. 例如，如果证书由使用者密钥标识符（SKI）引用，则 方法将选择具有此 SKI 的证书，并在其后面尝试一次，直到可以验证证书。For example, if the certificate is referenced by a Subject Key Identifier (SKI), the method will select certificates with this SKI and try them one after another until it can verify the certificate. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用封套签名对整个 XML 文档进行签名和验证。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature. remarks.format: ## Remarks 在 .NET Framework 版本1.1 中，不验证 x.509 证书。In version 1.1 of the .NET Framework, the X.509 certificate is not verified. 在版本2.0 和更高版本中，将验证 x.509 证书。In version 2.0 and later, the X.509 certificate is verified. 在 .NET Framework 版本2.0 及更高版本中， 方法将在 "通讯簿" 存储中搜索适用于验证的证书。In version 2.0 and later of the .NET Framework, the method will search the "AddressBook" store for certificates suitable for the verification. 例如，如果证书由使用者密钥标识符（SKI）引用，则 方法将选择具有此 SKI 的证书，并在其后面尝试一次，直到可以验证证书。For example, if the certificate is referenced by a Subject Key Identifier (SKI), the method will select certificates with this SKI and try them one after another until it can verify the certificate. ## Examples 下面的代码示例使用证书存储中的 x.509 证书对 XML 文档进行签名和验证。The following code example uses an X.509 certificate from a certificate store to sign and verify an XML document. remarks.format: ## Remarks 类解析由统一资源标识符（URI）命名的外部 XML 资源。The class resolves external XML resources named by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 如果你不信任 XML 文件的源，你可能不希望允许 XML 文件访问由 URI 命名的计算机资源。If you do not trust the source of the XML file, you might not want to allow the XML file to access computer resources named by the URI. 通过指定不同的 对象，可以使用 属性控制 XML 文件对计算机资源的访问级别。You can use the property to control the level of access that XML files have to computer resources by specifying different objects. 如果你不希望允许任何访问权限，则可以将此属性设置为 `null` （`Nothing` Visual Basic）。If you do not want to allow any access, you can set this property to `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可用于确保只使用某些转换，或者签名使用特定哈希算法等。This method can be used to ensure that only certain transforms are used, or that the signature uses a certain hash algorithm, and so on. 将属性设置为 `null` 会从 对象中删除所有签名格式验证。Setting the property to `null` removes all signature format validation from the object. 如果需要，还可以读取对象的当前委托并将其链接到该委托。You can also read the object's current delegate and chain to it if you want. 如果设置的是格式验证程序，则所提供的委托将作为输入参数接收 对象将被验证，并返回一个布尔值 `true`-如果格式是可接受的，则为; 如果不是，则为 `false`。If you are setting up a format validator, the delegate you supply will receive as an input parameter the object being verified and returns a Boolean value - `true` if the format is acceptable, `false` if it is not. 如果出于任何原因而使委托返回 `false`，则 对象将报告 XML 签名无效。If the delegate returns `false` for any reason, the object will report that the XML signature is not valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 字段的值为 "urn： mpeg： mpeg21：2003： 01-licenseTransform"The value of the field is "urn:mpeg:mpeg21:2003:01-REL-R-NS:licenseTransform" 使用此字段可方便地将值提供给用于 XMLDSIG 的元素的 URI 属性之一。Use this field to conveniently supply a value to one of the URI attributes of an element used for XMLDSIG. 类实现 字段描述的转换。The class implements the transform described by the field.
